website_summaries.verdict: Set of 3 emergency beacons that come in a convenient bag and have a long-distance visibility rating.
pros: Red lights are visible from as far as 2 miles
Magnetized back can stick to your car
Versatile enough for use in many situations
cons: These lights only have 2 modes, flashing and solid
Batteries can be difficult to replace

customer_reviews.title: What is your life worth to you?
customer_reviews.text: If you care about yourself or someone else, buy at least one set of these for their/your care. I have two sets in each of my vehicles. I was an EMT and can not tell you how many time motorists were hit or there car hit when parked along side of the road when disabled or just stopped. It happens all the time. The minute I stop along the road I have my emergency blinkers from the car on and these laid out along the road for at least 20 yards be hind me. If you are a skier you should have something like this with you on the slopes. Especially at night.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur L. Hill

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was pretty funny as I wandered around my car
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, the product works well, as advertised. The only caveat I'd offer is this: when I received them I went to try them on my car. I soon discovered that my car has an aluminum (or something) body and, as far as I can tell, there is not a magnetic surface anyplace on the car! So, if I ever need to use these, I'll find another way to display them. I thought it was pretty funny as I wandered around my car, rubbing these all over it only to find they wouldn't stick.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Great in emergencies, but don’t toss them on the road
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this while getting a flat tire on the highway in the dark. Visibility is great, and they are easy to use. A few pointers: 1. Open them up and fit batteries as they don’t come included 2. Don’t toss them onto the road, as the battery compartment easily pops off 3. There are a few different flashing light modes I felt much safer having these available to me especially in a low visibility situation.
customer_reviews.author: Zampcaster

customer_reviews.title: All 3 are broken
customer_reviews.text: I guess these can't handle being in hot car, which cars tend to get in the summer because all 3 are broken after 1.5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: STAY SAFE ON THE HIGHWAY
customer_reviews.text: BUY THESE NOW! My electrical system failed on a dark highway and I learned then why one should carry roadside beacons--because the car's flashing lights were defunct and I and my car were nearly invisible. I made it home safely, thank goodness, and ordered these. They are easy to use, snap onto the car, emit a BRIGHT light, and the container is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: comfy rules!

customer_reviews.title: They work...2 miles visibility? I doubt it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought Stone point and another brand. The other brand claims 1 mile visibility and they are twice as bright as the Stonepoint. The other brand is about $10 more but you get 4 disc's. I am not saying these are junk, I am sure they work. But there are others who are better and have a better buy than Stonepoint. Stonepoint's claim to 2 mile visibility and the other saying 1 mile.......And the other being at least twice as bright makes me question the integrity of Stonepoint.
customer_reviews.author: mike kleinsmith

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set of LED Emergnecy Roadside lights with Strong Magnet
customer_reviews.text: Bought two sets and better quality than other LED lights. Strong magnet and nice storage pouch. Used it once on the road and didn’t fall drown. Lights are not as bright due to the tinted red lens. Lens cover should have been clear red or to make LED light more visible. Blinkers interval are slow.
customer_reviews.author: sfbay55555

customer_reviews.title: I like them and they work.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why, but I expected them to be larger than they are. The measurements are in the listing, so that's on me. I was expecting something with a diameter larger than the palm of my hand. All three stacked together are not much taller than my hand from base of the palm to end of my finger tips. I haven't tried them at night to see how bright, but during the day when I turned one on it was visible enough I think it will be great at night.
customer_reviews.author: jammer2099

customer_reviews.title: COPY MY SETUP,  YOU WONT REGRET IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: THESE LIGHTS ARE CRAP AND EATS UP THE BATTERY QUICKLY, I KNOW FIRST HAND, I HAD 8 OF THEM AND THEY ALL FAILED ME AT LEAST 9+ *EMERGENCIES* !!!! THAT WAS BETWEEN 2010 AND 2015!! ITS NOW 2018; Now I got the DOT Triangles, Standup flares with reflectors and the Ground “orange” Flares with various light sequences, AWESOME SETUP!!!
customer_reviews.author: BLESS THEE

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put in batteries
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to work quite well. Easy to put in batteries, light is quite bright. Batteries are supposed to last 60 hours when blinking, that should be sufficient. The only reason I didn't give it 4 stars: Amazon listing says "limited warranty - 3 years", but box says 2 years. No instructions are given for warranty claim in the box, OR on the website. So, you should assume that if you have any problems, you are on your own.
customer_reviews.author: N. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Lights
customer_reviews.text: These are very bright. They flash or run continuously. Perfect attention grabbers inside or at night on the road. Of course in the daylight they are not as bright looking BUT you can see them well. A great value for the money spent. Very sturdy and I think you could drive over it with a car tire and not break it due to the strong design. I do not recommend driving over them, but accidents do happen, and it was not damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great high quality high impact lights
customer_reviews.text: I got these for our motor home in case of a road side emergency and to put on the coach when it's parked in front of the house while we're preparing it for a trip. You can choose between a steady light or flashing mode. Either way they are highly visible. I'm very happy with the design, quality construction and operation of these lights. I appreciate that standard 1.2v rechargeable batteries will work in these lights. Nice carrying/storing case. Very pleased. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Fishman

customer_reviews.title: Check your batteries every few months or these things won't do you any good. With discharged or corroded batteries
customer_reviews.text: Works well (when the batteries are not discharged or corroded). Check your batteries every few months or these things won't do you any good. With discharged or corroded batteries, these things are worthless and will do you no good as we recently found out when our car failed in the middle of heavy traffic. Our fault - they had been sitting in the car trunk for over a year and the batteries were shot. Be warned. Good product but it won't do you a bit of good if you don't keep it up.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J - Winter Park, FL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item last year and was impressed with it so I decided to order again. This beacon does what its advertised to do and attract/ warn others of a potentienal vehicle break down. I would recommend anyone who travels or drives at night to carry several of these. I plan on giving these out to family members as gifts too. Highly recommend. Magnetic is strong...
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Felix/ John Pytel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to put on top of our truck when we go kayaking at sunset. It makes it easy to spot the truck after dark. They are easily visible from a few hundred yards away. We've been using them for almost a year and haven't had any issues with them. The magnets are strong. I've accidentally left them on top of the truck once or twice when leaving the lake (oops) and they've stayed in place at speed of at least 50 mph.
customer_reviews.author: wolftrax

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective but there are better designed products
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed product but better than nothing. On/off button is not designed to allow you to keep the batteries in the unit as they could easily turn on while being stored killing the batteries. The purpose of this product is high visibility especially at night. Having to install the batteries when you should be focusing on deploying them and getting your vehicle roadworthy again is not practical. Only a single LED per unit so if the LED fails the unit is useless. Multiple LEDs would provide redundancy. Only two modes, solid or blinking. Simple and effective but there are better designed products out there at the same price.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stopher

customer_reviews.title: Can't be used!
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to open the usits to insert batteries. Therefore, they are useless and I am returning them!
customer_reviews.author: Scubad

customer_reviews.title: Bright
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had to use these yet but appear durable and handy. Placed one on my Forester and turned it on, very bright. Flashing mode worked. As described. Like the pouch they came in to keep them from rolling around in the back! Good safety item to have in any vehicle
customer_reviews.author: Marty3

customer_reviews.title: Great for Helicopter LZs
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my department as one of our helicopter landing zone lights failed. Professional lights cost a ton of money. At least $500 for professional ones. These lights honestly do the same thing for a fraction of the cost and are approved by the flight for life crews.
customer_reviews.author: WhitetailHunter23

customer_reviews.title: Safety Lights
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the rubber seal on it - it makes it hard to seal and if it were to break; then, I don't think the flasher would work. Seals could use an improvement. I'd hate to need to try to put batteries in if in a roadside emergency. Best use is to have them ready to go, and check every so often to make sure batteries are still working. I haven't had long enough to see if batteries run down over time.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have at least one of these lights in car
customer_reviews.text: Had scary incident at night where alternator died. Vehicle lost power while up on high overpass. I had no power to light up vehicle for passing cars. Luckily I keep flashlight in purse and used it out window until police arrived to slow down passing traffic. After incident purchased these as gifts for family members.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and have multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for lights to use on the back of a tractor with a snow blower to avoid being plowed under by a snow plow. I didn't want to drill holes and run wiring on a brand new tractor, so these were perfect for my needs. The magnets have been strong enough to hold them on so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best safety device for crossing guards
customer_reviews.text: I am a school crossing guard and use the lites on my stop sign. Since the stop sign is not metal, I velcroed the lites on each side of the hand held stop sign. It works great and can be seen for a long distance. This has provided me an extra level of security when directing traffic. Fantastic price and the quality can't be beat. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: roger francis

customer_reviews.title: Good gift
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly. I go ten sets and included them with several Christmas presents so my nieces and nephews had them for safety reasons. They look good and easy to get the batteries in but you do need quite a bit of batteries since I bought ten sets I needed to purchase 90 triple aaa batteries to provide with since each set needs 9 batteries (3 in each light)
customer_reviews.author: Dools

customer_reviews.title: DON'T FORGET THE BATTERIES
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully, we haven't had a use for these, however, they appear sturdy and easy to operate. CAUTION: Don't just shove this box in the trunk and think you are set; each of the units needs 3 AAA batteries (=9 AAA batteries). Although that fact appears on Amazon's product page, I could find NO warning/requirement re: batteries on the outside of the box. They lose a quality point for that.
customer_reviews.author: Owl at home

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: I always seem to hook up to trailers with iffy lights so I always make sure I have these with me to ensure people see me. Magnets could be stronger. I have lost them hitting bumps in the road but otherwise I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: These are great to carry
customer_reviews.text: These are great to carry. Suddenly, my trailer running lights went out. I bought these at a very high cost at a highway truckstop till I could get the lights fixed after arriving at the destination. I worried bumps in the road and rain would know these magnetic things off but it did not. I was impressed. I ordered additional ones here on Amazon to keep in reserve for future emergency uses. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: estacadaoregon

customer_reviews.title: Not impervious to being run over . . . .
customer_reviews.text: I used these when my car was inoperable on the side of the road. The interesting thing is that some drivers see these not as a cue to move to the other lane, but as a challenge. Consequently, shortly after putting them out, one driver decided to run over each and every one of them and succeeded in destroying them all. They work, but I think they are best used with the fold out triangles. Then the triangles are illuminated in flashing red light for better visability. No one has ever decided to run over my emergency fold out triangles seeing as they are quite large and might damage a car, unlike this item.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Broken gaskets on new lights
customer_reviews.text: Upon receipt I opened up the lights to install batteries (3 AAA each). In two of the three lights, the small rubber gasket used to water seal the light was broken. Design defect or not, unacceptable. Not sure if it is worth replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Hubby11

customer_reviews.title: Broken Rubber Seal
customer_reviews.text: I received these electronic road flares and one of them has a broken rubber seal, shown in the image. It looks like it was cast wrong. It makes it very difficult to close, and if these were ever needed to be used in wet conditions I'm not sure that they would work. Otherwise they seem like they would be nice. As this is a gift, I don't want to give a friend a broken road flare in case the worst happens.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Costanzo

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: It may be just me, but it was very difficult to unscrew the lights t put in batteries. And close to impossible to refasten them into position. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Desert  Nurse Practitioner

customer_reviews.title: and they worked great! I wasn't stressed about getting run over by ...
customer_reviews.text: Already used them once when I had to replace a tire by the side of the road in darkness, and they worked great! I wasn't stressed about getting run over by passing vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than appearance in photo
customer_reviews.text: Wish they were rechargeable they take 3 AAA batteries. Each. They look much smaller in person than in photo. Hopefully they serve the purpose
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.T

customer_reviews.title: Bright, small and rather sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these over chemical flares for ease of use and no nonsense storage. The devices are small, but surprisingly bright (two modes, flash and constant). A useful feature is the magnet on the bottom, and it has small soft feet to prevent scratching. The padding is not deep so you still have to be rather careful. The overall housing seems rather solid, did not have any give and a pleasant heft to it (with batteries). Note that as with other reviewers, that battery housing was a little annoying to both remove and place batteries. But it was not a deal breaker. It is worth the money to have in your car for that rainy day.
customer_reviews.author: FamilyMan "Don"

customer_reviews.title: Work ok but magnet is weak and doesn’t hold well
customer_reviews.text: Weak magnet, and small washers on back prevent it holding on to steel surface well, removed rubber washer and still too weak to hold onto a trailer or auto!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: Fulfilled by Amazon, so, came fast. Magnetic feature is the best. You don't have to get out of car to use. Light is bright as described. Second order -- giving to sister, brother, nieces and nephews. Ordering more for family friend and cousins.
customer_reviews.author: V-chic

customer_reviews.title: These flashers are perfect for traffic control
customer_reviews.text: These flashers are perfect for traffic control. They can take quite a beating too. I had heavy, dually trucks drive right over them and none cracked. The only downside: The power-switch is located next to the "dome" on the upper side of the product. So if a vehicle drives right over it, the flare likely gets turned off and one needs to switch it back on again. This does not happen all the time, but it happens. Besides that, I am 100% happy with these flares. They're bright, compact and do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Bernd K.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. I have other kinds like this and they work. These were a gift and 2 other ones and none worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amandah

customer_reviews.title: Better seals would seal the deal
customer_reviews.text: These were much smaller then I expected which isn't a bad thing, I will probably pick up a second set. Only thing I would say is the o ring that seals the top and bottom looks cheap, so when putting the batteries in don't man handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Justsumdude

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: We use these a lot in our oilfield security business. They are heavy duty and are flawless in their performance. We would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: GARY LYNN THIBODAUX

customer_reviews.title: Red blinking light
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality product. Must have in all your family Vehicles. The item can be a great Safety item. If for a bike, person, Etc.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D

customer_reviews.title: but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I am concerned about the quality of these. One of the 3 I received had a broken O-ring seal. While the light still functions, the broken seal eliminates any water resistance. These are reasonably bright, they have decent daytime visibility, but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for speedy delivery -- gift for son for in ...
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for speedy delivery -- gift for son for in case of emergency now that he's on his own and wanted him to have this in case anything were to happen and he was alone or something. Not sure if it's been used yet but I will update in the case he did / or when he does :-)
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Kibler

customer_reviews.title: Get these for all your cars!
customer_reviews.text: I bought flares for all my family members several years ago. They crumbled all over the box I had them in–not useful at all. When I saw these battery flares, I took a second look. They got good reviews so I ordered a st. They are very high quality and I love the choice of blinking or steady light. Also, they are magnetic so you can but them on top of your car. The bag is sturdy and keeps everything neat. I ordered 4 more, now my entire family is covered. I also bought extra batteries for each one.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: good item, nice storage bag, batteries difficult to insert.
customer_reviews.text: Happy with quality of item and storage bag. Instructions easy to read and item easy to open for battery insertion. Storage bag of good quality and actually has room for extra batterys and small flashlight. Storage bag nicely labled so you don't forget what is in it. Happy with it. Will probably order one for each car and a few for "stocking stuffers"for kids. Complaints about battery inserting difficulties somewhat true. Definitely more trouble getting these batteries in than expected or usual... hence 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: NW LADY

customer_reviews.title: Nice lights, storage bag needs work, button too easy to hit
customer_reviews.text: The lights work very well in both flashing and always-on modes. The magnetic base is nice to stick on your car. The little rubber button to activate is too easily bumped when stored in the flimsy storage bag. I drained a number of batteries without knowing at least one flare had activated in the bag. Flare button needs to be redesigned to have a small protector 'hood' or something over it to keep it from accidentally being activated when in the bag. The pouches in the bag are almost worthless and need to be redesigned with sturdier and thicker/foam fabric to help prevent flares impacting each other.
customer_reviews.author: C. Newhouse

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: I almost never give a 5 star review. These are magnetic and battery powered. Road flares can be a bit cheaper but will not last any where near as long as these do. You can set them to blink or stay solid. Come in a nice little pouch which I keep in the car. This will make great gifts as well. Plan on buying more. Would recommend to anyone. Be safe on the road. If you found my review helpful, please click below. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony E.

customer_reviews.title: Check the seals first
customer_reviews.text: Tried these twice. Both times a seal was broken and therefore not waterproof. Did not try a 3rd time
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Sauvain

customer_reviews.title: Straight flash, homie.
customer_reviews.text: At first, 2/3 lights had full function. Then all three worked. It probably had to do with the cold weather and them being shipped in subzero temps. But these little buggers go inside of a small emergency kit in the car. They are bright, sturdy (it shows a picture of a car running over them) and the lights will get attention. They don't eat up a ton of space either. 3 AAA batteries PER beacon though!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bursaw

customer_reviews.title: MUST PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, a great value in security....bought a set for myself and my daughter. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Brown

customer_reviews.title: Stonepoint emergency LED road flare kit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for all my our kids to carry in their cars while they travel at night. I also purchased one for us. I like that it comes with a storage bag and i can put it in a cubby hole for storage and it wont be in the way or lost
customer_reviews.author: caj

customer_reviews.title: Safety is #1
customer_reviews.text: Being into classic cars many do not have hazard signals. WIthout installing any, some of us car guys found these stick-on emergency lights to work great. You need to stop. You attach them to the trunk, turn them on and you're all set. They make a great gift for the classic car collector.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Necela

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surpised
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how well these work. They are extraordinarily bright LED lights. I had an issue removing the battery cover on one light it looks like a process was skipped in cleaning up the plastic (there was quite a bit of over mold left.) Once that was cleaned up with a blade it opens and closes like the rest. The pouch has internal pockets for the lights and extra batteries. Of note I probably would not store this with batteries installed they will probably corrode after time, leave them in the storage pouch till needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tinguran

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is great. magnets will hold light under rough driving conditions. visable from a far distance.
customer_reviews.author: Danny L. McElvain

customer_reviews.title: Good product for price
customer_reviews.text: Good magnets and they have a little rubber on contact surface to help from scratching/scuffing paint.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: safety first
customer_reviews.text: I liked them so well, That I need to get a set for my wife's car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the car emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: Out of sight, but not out of mind. I travel quite a bit back and forth to the coast over mountain roads, which can often get pummeled with rain or snow without much warning. Having a way for other cars to see me in case of an issue in the car brings a sigh of relief. Easily tucks away into the emergency kit. Hoping I never have to use it - but it's exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: Well for the price I paid very very good and alwaya comes in handy,everyone should at least buy a set.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Very nice & bright.
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice & bright in the dark. Hope my parents never have to use them. (I gifted them these to use when they travel in their 5th wheel)
customer_reviews.author: Speed Queen

customer_reviews.title: Light it Up!
customer_reviews.text: Second set I bought, very bright and compact. Comes in a pouch u can store away in ur trunk. Thick sturdy plastic housing. Must get for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: SZEPNSHER

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I used to carry sulfur flares in the trunk but they deteriorate and aren't all that safe. These things work great! I bought a few packages of lithium batteries and stuck them in the black bag along with the beacon flares. When I need them they'll be there ready to go. Simple, solid and a life saver when you need them.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very bright. I bought two more and swapped out ...
customer_reviews.text: Very bright. I bought two more and swapped out my old flares.
customer_reviews.author: Kayamper

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: These come in a nice bag and fit in my little storage compartment in the back of my Ford Escape. I wanted something I could use in case I break down, which I don't plan on happening, but we never plan on it. The only downside I didn't think about before buying them is I live in Alaska where the snow can get deep. Placing these on the ground may not work; however with the magnetic base I could place them on my car. Overall I am happy with the purchase and hope I never HAVE to use them.
customer_reviews.author: mjdubyak

customer_reviews.title: Better quality than expected
customer_reviews.text: Perception of quality was better than many of the reviews. Had no problem opening/closing the housing. Problem with too small battery holder must have been resolved, because putting in Duracell Brand AAA cells was no issue. Dealt with 'phantom load' discharge problem by putting small slip of paper (cut from a business card) between one battery terminal and battery. Included warning note in each pouch to remind user to pull slip out before using, a 5 second task. There is an O-ring seal around the top lens; probably OK for bad weather but not for submergence. Brighter than some views suggested, but you may want to position lens into the direction of traffic.
customer_reviews.author: mrlimpett

customer_reviews.title: Hope to never have to use these
customer_reviews.text: So I have no way to judge them on effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: SlumLord

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase. All should have for driver safety.
customer_reviews.text: Gave one to each family member with car. Traggic accident in our area. This would have helped. Like an instant road flair if disabled car, lose power and have no emergency flasher ability.
customer_reviews.author: sandra hardenstine

customer_reviews.title: Great saftey gift!
customer_reviews.text: I gave all my grand daughters one for Christmas, thank God none of the girls have had to try them out, but knowing that they have them just in case is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anne Baker

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with this Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to put on mu 5th Wheel Travel Trailer when it is parked at a rest stop overnight with the slide-outs out. I've used them four times, running all night and have still not needed to change the batteries. These are well built, durable and have magnets on the back so they will stick well to any steel surface. They are bright and very noticeable. They have three settings - Off, steady on red, and flashing red. Comes with a nice carrying case. I recommend these...
customer_reviews.author: Dave Koch

customer_reviews.title: Great lights to have to save your life or to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit along with a yellow colored one and this lights rock. They are very very bright and would be seen in the daylight with no problem, you could see these in the dark a couple of miles away with three of them close to each other. Great lights to have to save your life or to be seen so you can get some help. Highly recommend these lights for complete safety.
customer_reviews.author: B/rad

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Could have been brighter light pulses, little faster rate of pulsing. Good idea, well made.
customer_reviews.author: bogdan bilanicz

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend these to anyone looking for the best warning device's ...
customer_reviews.text: I use flares all the time at work and these flares are very bright and can be seen a long distance away ! No more regular flares again for My Officer's and I because these take a second to turn on and place without the hazards of Fire so all of My vehicle's are and will always be equipped with these ! I would highly recommend these to anyone looking for the best warning device's on the market ! Larry A Koertje. PRO-GUARD
customer_reviews.author: Larry Andrew Koertje     PRO-GUARD

customer_reviews.title: Handy but light
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of the FlareAlert Pro beacons () along with this set of three standard FlareAlert beacons. The standard beacons have a translucent cover where the Pros have a clear red cover with a center lens. The magnets are decent, though the magnets on the Pros seem a bit stronger. The batteries went in easy and all three beacons fit nicely in the case. These are very handy to have on hand in the vehicle and safer than flares. The beacons also have two modes, steady or flashing, which is a nice touch depending on the situation. All of them are now part of my emergency bag in my truck.
customer_reviews.author: T. Andrus

customer_reviews.title: Strong Emergency Flasher
customer_reviews.text: We are purchasing these beacons for the entire family. They are easy to assemble, they store in a bag provided, and easy to set up. We purchased them for a travel trailer and were so pleased we put it on everyone stocking list.
customer_reviews.author: This is me

customer_reviews.title: Super bright!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to use, and really bright. Would catch attention even in daylight or bad weather. Magnets on the back make it able to stick right on the car, too.
customer_reviews.author: GriffinDoor

customer_reviews.title: Battery corrosion, but fixable with vinegar
customer_reviews.text: These are good lights. I bought a set for our two cars and take them out once or twice a year to test them. Usually, I find battery corrosion on at least one of the three (in both sets). I chalk this up to normal storage in warm conditions (we live in Florida). I just discard the corroded batteries and clean the terminals up with white vinegar. This works just fine and the units function as intended.
customer_reviews.author: David Feeney

customer_reviews.title: he likes it.
customer_reviews.text: gave this to my brother for X-mas, said he likes it, as he will put one in his car and one in his truck, and one in his dump truck.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth P. Argenta

customer_reviews.title: Replace phosphorus flares with these!
customer_reviews.text: We sell these at our lake association for flare night in place of regular flares that contain phosphorus which contaminates lake waters. They have become very popular!
customer_reviews.author: Terry A.

customer_reviews.title: Two out of three work fine. The wire connection on one is faulty
customer_reviews.text: Two out of three work fine. The wire connection on one is faulty. Didn't feel like returning. I would much rather get a product that works right the first time; don't want the hassle of returns.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Crumbaker

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 sets to put in my kids cars. Very high quality and easy to use. I did have 2 broken o’rings when installing the batteries, but emailed the manf. and heard back in less than 24 hours. They are sending me 6 new o’rings. Highly recommend these over the standard “flame type” flares. Much safer to use.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great lights to keep in your trunk
customer_reviews.text: These little lights are great, much better to carry around in your trunk than a flare. They take three AAA batteries and come in a little case. The switch sets them to strobe or illuminate continuously. The back is magnetic so they can stick to your cart if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Nifty
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used except to test them quickly, but these are nifty. Bright, easy to use, and definitely won't turn on and run down the batteries accidentally. Bag is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: seth

customer_reviews.title: It is good
customer_reviews.text: It is good. It is doing what it says. bright enough
customer_reviews.author: Filippos Pantazis

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Beacon flares
customer_reviews.text: My wife ran out of gas one night she called 911 and they said someone would be their in about one hour and to turn on her fourways well by the time they got there the battery was dead and they had to jump the car. so I went online and found the flareAlert. People were saying they were too hard to open well I had no problem plus I had no problem putting the batterys in. I got six of them and went out one night to try them and they lit up the entire block. By the way I'm 73 years old with arthritis in my hands
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Jettmann Orr Presson

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 4 times; 2 of every 3 worked
customer_reviews.text: These lights work well when they work, but each of the 4 times I ordered them, I got 1 non-working light. I finally have 2 working sets, but it was annoying to have to go through the process of testing and returning.
customer_reviews.author: fish

customer_reviews.title: Light is not as bright as expected for LEDs
customer_reviews.text: Thought they would be brighter. Also was surprised that they did not come with batteries for the price paid. I failed to notice that in the description prior to buying.
customer_reviews.author: John and Marilee Streett

customer_reviews.title: Emergency blinking lights
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty cool. Battery operated, and magnetic. Turn them on and stick them to your vehicle. Very bright.
customer_reviews.author: William Russell

customer_reviews.title: Nice and bright
customer_reviews.text: Have not used these in an emergency situation, but have tested them. They are very bright and stick to any metallic surface. The storage pouch has a convenient place to store the necessary batteries. I read other reviews where people said it was hard to install the batteries. We did not have a problem. Will I have an actual emergency situation where I need these? I don't know, but I like knowing they are there.
customer_reviews.author: K. Evans

customer_reviews.title: These units are a little dimmer than the sets I ...
customer_reviews.text: These units are a little dimmer than the sets I purchased several years ago. The vendor has changed these unit to use 3 AAA batteries versus the older style 3 AA battery. There is a difference in brightness and duration with the AAAs. None the less, they still work as advertised and are a plus for anyone's vehicle on a dark night.
customer_reviews.author: Ray S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Auto Safety product
customer_reviews.text: They are very bright, very tough and very magnetic! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the on button is too easy to be pressed while in the bag. This then bleeds the batteries without you ever knowing. The fix for this is to leave one battery out of each light and store it in the handy little pouch that I'm guessing was designed for this purpose. I've bought a set for each car.
customer_reviews.author: TomInIll

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Top quality product - highly recommend. I was apprehensive about purchasing this because of some of the earlier reviews saying how hard it was to insert the batteries. Not sure if they have redesigned the units or if the earlier reviewers had physical limitations, but I had no problems with the batteries - easy as pie. These units are super bright and top quality. I'm buying another set for my second car! Great idea well executed.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: These work great! Be sure to store AAA batteries in a separate plastic bag so the lights don't get damaged if batteries get old.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Love these emergency lights I haven't had the opportunity to ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these emergency lights I haven't had the opportunity to use them yet. but I feel safe just knowing that I have them in my car if I should ever need them
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalsh

customer_reviews.title: Ribert
customer_reviews.text: Great emergency lights. Gives clear notice to oncoming traffic. Makes working on your vehicle safer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Gave to my son for his truck. A must have safety product. Appears to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price 👍
customer_reviews.text: Great for working on side of the road to direct traffic around you. Sometimes the wrecker lights just aren't enough, just out these up the road from you to add advanced warning when working on a car on the side of a street.
customer_reviews.author: PKLS

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: I use these to light the path to telescope when I set up for pubic use. These last all night!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine B.

customer_reviews.title: New battery died after several uses
customer_reviews.text: Used twice in past month (each time about 5mins) now i had to use them again, but one of the lights wasn’t working... I used Duracell batteries... had to replace for the new ones... will see how long it will last... for now 4stars (might go lower soon - if batteries die again after 10 minutes of total use) Will keep you posted... Overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Alina C

customer_reviews.title: Very bright and attract attention
customer_reviews.text: Very bright, great magnet, but the 3 AAA batteries required per unit, not included
customer_reviews.author: Big Ed

customer_reviews.title: ready to roll
customer_reviews.text: about the size and shape of a pregnant hockey puck, these little lights flash red, or just stay lit red ( choice is made by depressing button). they each use 3 aaa batteries- a bit of a bunch affixing 9 batteries to something you hope to never use. included is a snappy carrying case, and i put mine in my emergency box in my trunk. well worth the money and easier to light than flares. these are my choice- 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hope I Never Need
customer_reviews.text: I do hope we never need to remove these from their convenient carrying case, but if you do, I feel certain they will come in handy and possibly safe a life. Bright flashing lights. Easy to insert batteries. Strong magnet. Will definitely be ordering another set for our other car and one for each of our children to keep in their cars. Talk about the perfect holiday gift? This is IT!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Vogel

product_meta.title: Stonepoint Emergency LED Road Flare Kit – Set of 3 Super Bright LED Roadside Beacons with Magnetic Base – Flashing or Steady Red Lights Visible Up to 2 Miles Away – Includes Storage Bag
feature_bullets: SUPER BRIGHT LIGHT - The LED Emergency Beacons produce light with 360-degree visibility up to two miles away. Each light has a 20-hour run time in steady mode, while it has a 60-hour run time in flash mode. The light has a wattage of 0.5, and a 50,000-hour LED life.
SMALL AND LIGHTWEIGHT - The LED Safety Lights are small and lightweight, and make a great addition to any emergency kit, garage, workshop, RV, boat, and outdoor adventures.
SAFE TO USE - The lights have a powerful magnetic base, and are crush resistant for up to a 6,000-pound vehicle. They also replace dangerous strike flares and are water resistant.
COMES IN TWO MODES - The Beacons come in two modes: flash and steady. Each beacon requires three AAA alkaline batteries (not included).
PACK OF 3 - Includes 3 flares with storage bags.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars610 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
